intro: Trichosanthes obtusa, commonly known as the blunt-twisted gourd, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces large, orange-yellow fruits that are typically harvested when mature. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it has tendrils that help it climb. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female blooms on the same plant.
